original: The ability of the Earth to support life was traditionally believed to be dependent on sunlight. However, a significant discovery in 1977 during an exploratory dive to the Galapagos Rift aboard the submersible Alvin challenged this notion. Scientists found colonies of giant tube worms, clams, crustaceans, mussels, and various other organisms thriving around undersea volcanic features known as black smokers.
